          Comment 11<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1158010#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      mkwst@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/189620131" title="mkwst@chromium.org"><!---->mkwst@chromium.org<!----></a>
      mkwst@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->mkwst@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Dec 15, 2020, 2:00 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 15, 2020, 2:00 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1158010#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 15, 2020, 2:00 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1158010#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 15, 2020, 2:00 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          dom@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          dom@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        1.  Unless something has changed in the last year or so, fetching for CSS is not yet well-defined. <span class="line"><!---->1.  Unless something has changed in the last year or so, fetching for CSS is not yet well-defined. <!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-referrer-policy/#integration-with-css<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-referrer-policy/#integration-with-css"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-referrer-policy/#integration-with-css<!----></a> hand-waves at the problem in ways that we considered good-enough while writing it, but it would be excellent for someone (not it!) to actually hammer out the integration. dom@ might be interested.<span class="line"><!----> hand-waves at the problem in ways that we considered good-enough while writing it, but it would be excellent for someone (not it!) to actually hammer out the integration. dom@ might be interested.<!----></span><br><br>2.  Regardless of spec text, `<base>` should not influence the referrer. The text above points to what that change was supposed to achieve: the stylesheet's URL should be used as the referrer, not the document's URL. In this case, though, the stylesheet is inline in the document, so we do want to use the document's URL.<span class="line"><!---->2.  Regardless of spec text, `&lt;base&gt;` should not influence the referrer. The text above points to what that change was supposed to achieve: the stylesheet's URL should be used as the referrer, not the document's URL. In this case, though, the stylesheet is inline in the document, so we do want to use the document's URL.<!----></span><br><br>This does have security implications, insofar as some sites use `referer` as an access-control measure: it shouldn't be possible for a site to forge cross-origin `referer` headers. I'm not sure whether it's possible to send CORS-enabled requests from stylesheets (perhaps fonts?), but it would be interesting to verify that the `Origin` header and the `Sec-Fetch-Site` headers are behaving correctly as well, as I have vague recollections of those being wrapped up in the same data source as the referrer. TL;DR: Medium severity feels right.<span class="line"><!---->This does have security implications, insofar as some sites use `referer` as an access-control measure: it shouldn't be possible for a site to forge cross-origin `referer` headers. I'm not sure whether it's possible to send CORS-enabled requests from stylesheets (perhaps fonts?), but it would be interesting to verify that the `Origin` header and the `Sec-Fetch-Site` headers are behaving correctly as well, as I have vague recollections of those being wrapped up in the same data source as the referrer. TL;DR: Medium severity feels right.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>
      
      
      
        
          Comment 12<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1158010#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      jochen@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/113376574" title="jochen@chromium.org"><!---->jochen@chromium.org<!----></a>

        yeah, the intention is that if it's an inline stylesheet, the document's referrer should be used, but if it's an standalone stylesheet, that stylesheet's base URL (well, whatever it's called, it's not defined in CSS, but it should be a thing that can't be overwritten) should be used<span class="line"><!---->yeah, the intention is that if it's an inline stylesheet, the document's referrer should be used, but if it's an standalone stylesheet, that stylesheet's base URL (well, whatever it's called, it's not defined in CSS, but it should be a thing that can't be overwritten) should be used<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        RE: <span class="line"><!---->RE: <!----></span>#c11<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c11"><!---->#c11<!----></a>: mkwst@: interesting to verify that the `Origin` header and the `Sec-Fetch-Site` headers are behaving correctly<span class="line"><!---->: mkwst@: interesting to verify that the `Origin` header and the `Sec-Fetch-Site` headers are behaving correctly<!----></span><br><br>Both `Origin` and `Sec-Fetch-Site` are based on network::ResourceRequest::request_initiator (soon-to-be-verified everywhere against `request_initiator_site_lock` and so unspoofable/protected against compromised renderers).<span class="line"><!---->Both `Origin` and `Sec-Fetch-Site` are based on network::ResourceRequest::request_initiator (soon-to-be-verified everywhere against `request_initiator_site_lock` and so unspoofable/protected against compromised renderers).<!----></span><br><br>OTOH, (based on <span class="line"><!---->OTOH, (based on <!----></span>#c12<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c12"><!---->#c12<!----></a>) it seems the `Referer` header can mismatch `request_initiator_site_lock` in the following scenario:<span class="line"><!---->) it seems the `Referer` header can mismatch `request_initiator_site_lock` in the following scenario:<!----></span><br><br>    a.com/main.html: <link rel="stylesheet" href="<span class="line"><!---->    a.com/main.html: &lt;link rel="stylesheet" href="<!----></span>https://b.com/style.css<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://b.com/style.css"><!---->https://b.com/style.css<!----></a>"><span class="line"><!---->"&gt;<!----></span><br>    b.com/style.css: @import url("<span class="line"><!---->    b.com/style.css: @import url("<!----></span>https://c.com/nested.css");<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://c.com/nested.css&quot;);"><!---->https://c.com/nested.css");<!----></a><br><br>Here, the fetch for c.com/nested.css will use `Sec-Fetch-Site` based on request_initiator=a.com (all requests within the frame use the same URLLoaderFactory), but (based on <span class="line"><!---->Here, the fetch for c.com/nested.css will use `Sec-Fetch-Site` based on request_initiator=a.com (all requests within the frame use the same URLLoaderFactory), but (based on <!----></span>#c12<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c12"><!---->#c12<!----></a>) `Referer` should be based on b.com/style.css (IIUC) - the latter is incompatible with `request_initiator_origin_lock`.<span class="line"><!---->) `Referer` should be based on b.com/style.css (IIUC) - the latter is incompatible with `request_initiator_origin_lock`.<!----></span><br><br>So, if I understood the above correctly, then we get the following conclusion: `Referer` should not be used as an access-control measure / security mechanism (because it is not secure against compromised renderers).<span class="line"><!---->So, if I understood the above correctly, then we get the following conclusion: `Referer` should not be used as an access-control measure / security mechanism (because it is not secure against compromised renderers).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        > Both `Origin` and `Sec-Fetch-Site` are ... unspoofable<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Both `Origin` and `Sec-Fetch-Site` are ... unspoofable<!----></span><br><br>Excellent, thanks Lukasz!<span class="line"><!---->Excellent, thanks Lukasz!<!----></span><br><br>> it seems the `Referer` header can mismatch `request_initiator_site_lock` in the following scenario: ... `Referer` should not be used as an access-control measure<span class="line"><!---->&gt; it seems the `Referer` header can mismatch `request_initiator_site_lock` in the following scenario: ... `Referer` should not be used as an access-control measure<!----></span><br><br>Correct. It shouldn't be used; other mechanisms are more robust. "Should", however, has little impact on "does". :) It would be ideal for us to limit the scenarios in which this mechanism has unexpected values to those that require actively corrupting the renderer. (So, I could live with "Low" severity instead of "Medium", but it's still a bug we ought to fix.)<span class="line"><!---->Correct. It shouldn't be used; other mechanisms are more robust. "Should", however, has little impact on "does". :) It would be ideal for us to limit the scenarios in which this mechanism has unexpected values to those that require actively corrupting the renderer. (So, I could live with "Low" severity instead of "Medium", but it's still a bug we ought to fix.)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

document's URL as referrer<span class="line"><!---->css: Make fetches from inline CSS use the document's URL as referrer<!----></span><br><br>Right now, fetches from inline CSS use the inline CSS's base URL<span class="line"><!---->Right now, fetches from inline CSS use the inline CSS's base URL<!----></span><br>instead of the URL from the context that embeds the inline CSS: for<span class="line"><!---->instead of the URL from the context that embeds the inline CSS: for<!----></span><br>instance, loading a<span class="line"><!---->instance, loading a<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>source-site.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source-site.com"><!---->source-site.com<!----></a> page with the following code<span class="line"><!----> page with the following code<!----></span><br>  <base href="<span class="line"><!---->  &lt;base href="<!----></span>https://other-site.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" type=text/css&gt; @import(<!----></span>'<span class="line"><!---->'<!----></span>best-sheet.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://best-sheet.com"><!---->best-sheet.com<!----></a>') </style><span class="line"><!---->') &lt;/style&gt;<!----></span><br>should lead to the<span class="line"><!---->should lead to the<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>best-sheet.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://best-sheet.com"><!---->best-sheet.com<!----></a> sheet getting fetched with a<span class="line"><!----> sheet getting fetched with a<!----></span><br>source-site.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source-site.com"><!---->source-site.com<!----></a> referrer, but it will currently provide an<span class="line"><!----> referrer, but it will currently provide an<!----></span><br>other-site.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://other-site.com"><!---->other-site.com<!----></a> referrer. However, if the imported sheet from<span class="line"><!----> referrer. However, if the imported sheet from<!----></span><br>best-sheet.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://best-sheet.com"><!---->best-sheet.com<!----></a> makes more nested fetches, those nested requests should<span class="line"><!----> makes more nested fetches, those nested requests should<!----></span><br>use<span class="line"><!---->use<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>best-sheet.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://best-sheet.com"><!---->best-sheet.com<!----></a> as the basis for their referrers (as they do<span class="line"><!----> as the basis for their referrers (as they do<!----></span><br>currently).<span class="line"><!---->currently).<!----></span><br><br>This CL updates CSSParserContext's referrer setting logic to roughly do<span class="line"><!---->This CL updates CSSParserContext's referrer setting logic to roughly do<!----></span><br>the following:<span class="line"><!---->the following:<!----></span><br>- inline CSS: use the embedding document's URL as the referrer, or, for<span class="line"><!---->- inline CSS: use the embedding document's URL as the referrer, or, for<!----></span><br>srcdoc iframes, walk up the frame tree until hitting a non-srcdoc frame<span class="line"><!---->srcdoc iframes, walk up the frame tree until hitting a non-srcdoc frame<!----></span><br>- requests from fetched stylesheets: just as currently, use the fetched<span class="line"><!---->- requests from fetched stylesheets: just as currently, use the fetched<!----></span><br>sheet's URL as the basis for constructing the referrer<span class="line"><!---->sheet's URL as the basis for constructing the referrer<!----></span><br><br>This seemed like it required refactoring CSSParserContext slightly<span class="line"><!---->This seemed like it required refactoring CSSParserContext slightly<!----></span><br>because there are constructors that take both a Document and a base URL,<span class="line"><!---->because there are constructors that take both a Document and a base URL,<!----></span><br>and it's not obvious from the constructor signature whether the<span class="line"><!---->and it's not obvious from the constructor signature whether the<!----></span><br>Document or the base URL should be the one that provides the referrer.<span class="line"><!---->Document or the base URL should be the one that provides the referrer.<!----></span><br>To resolve this ambiguity, the refactor updates these CSSParserContext<span class="line"><!---->To resolve this ambiguity, the refactor updates these CSSParserContext<!----></span><br>constructors to take caller-provided Referrer objects.<span class="line"><!---->constructors to take caller-provided Referrer objects.<!----></span><br><br>Change-Id: If5a99d8057dff5e771e821d0e1f605566e28ff1d<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id:         This bug requires manual review: We are only 10 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 10 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: govind@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), marinakz@(ChromeOS), srinivassista @(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: govind@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), marinakz@(ChromeOS), srinivassista @(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

But if there's any doubt at all about stability risks, we don't, so I'll adjust labels thusly.<span class="line"><!---->Per policy yes, for externally reported medium severity bugs we do merge them back to both beta and stable.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

as the basis for their referrers (as they do<!----></span><br>currently).<span class="line"><!---->currently).<!----></span><br><br>This CL updates CSSParserContext's referrer setting logic to roughly do<span class="line"><!---->This CL updates CSSParserContext's referrer setting logic to roughly do<!----></span><br>the following:<span class="line"><!---->the following:<!----></span><br>- inline CSS: use the embedding document's URL as the referrer, or, for<span class="line"><!---->- inline CSS: use the embedding document's URL as the referrer, or, for<!----></span><br>srcdoc iframes, walk up the frame tree until hitting a non-srcdoc frame<span class="line"><!---->srcdoc iframes, walk up the frame tree until hitting a non-srcdoc frame<!----></span><br>- requests from fetched stylesheets: just as currently, use the fetched<span class="line"><!---->- requests from fetched stylesheets: just as currently, use the fetched<!----></span><br>sheet's URL as the basis for constructing the referrer<span class="line"><!---->sheet's URL as the basis for constructing the referrer<!----></span><br><br>This seemed like it required refactoring CSSParserContext slightly<span class="line"><!---->This seemed like it required refactoring CSSParserContext slightly<!----></span><br>because there are constructors that take both a Document and a base URL,<span class="line"><!---->because there are constructors that take both a Document and a base URL,<!----></span><br>and it's not obvious from the constructor signature whether the<span class="line"><!---->and it's not obvious from the constructor signature whether the<!----></span><br>Document or the base URL should be the one that provides the referrer.<span class="line"><!---->Document or the base URL should be the one that provides the referrer.<!----></span><br>To resolve this ambiguity, the refactor updates these CSSParserContext<span class="line"><!---->To resolve this ambiguity, the refactor updates these CSSParserContext<!----></span><br>constructors to take caller-provided Referrer objects.<span class="line"><!---->constructors to take caller-provided Referrer objects.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>0b1539fcb923056624d4adc84b88140d367d92da<a            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);

        mr-issue-metadata {

          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

            Issue 1158010: Security: Referrer Header Spoofing Vulnerability via <base> tags 
          <h1>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by techn...@gmail.com (Dec 11, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by techn...@gmail.com (Dec 11, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>While doing some analysis it was observed that when a <base> tag is set to a page and a css request is being made to a page, Chrome browser makes use of the url in base tag as a referrer header value , this is only valid in case a base header is set , in case the header is absent a plain requirest is made to the url for css call.<span class="line"><!---->While doing some analysis it was observed that when a &lt;base&gt; tag is set to a page and a css request is being made to a page, Chrome browser makes use of the url in base tag as a referrer header value , this is only valid in case a base header is set , in case the header is absent a plain requirest is made to the url for css call.<!----></span><br><br>This was only observed with chrome and other browsers set the referrer to URI requesting the resource.<span class="line"><!---->This was only observed with chrome and other browsers set the referrer to URI requesting the resource.<!----></span><br><br>For example in below code, chrome doesnt set any referrer header automatically when making request to<span class="line"><!---->For example in below code, chrome doesnt set any referrer header automatically when making request to<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>x.burpcollaborator.net<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://x.burpcollaborator.net"><!---->x.burpcollaborator.net<!----></a> .<span class="line"><!----> .<!----></span><br><br><br><html><head><span class="line"><!---->&lt;html&gt;&lt;head&gt;<!----></span><br>      <title>Test</title><span class="line"><!---->      &lt;title&gt;Test&lt;/title&gt;<!----></span><br><style><span class="line"><!---->&lt;style&gt;<!----></span><br>    @import '<span class="line"><!---->    @import '<!----></span>https://x.burpcollaborator.net/x';<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://x.burpcollaborator.net/x';"><!---->https://x.burpcollaborator.net/x';<!----></a><!--change this to any address of your choice and verify the referrer header!--><span class="line"><!---->&lt;!--change this to any address of your choice and verify the referrer header!--&gt;<!----></span><br></style><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/style&gt;<!----></span><br>   </head><span class="line"><!---->   &lt;/head&gt;<!----></span><br>   <body><span class="line"><!---->   &lt;body&gt;<!----></span><br>test<span class="line"><!---->test<!----></span><br><body></html><span to<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a> in case base header is set , it can be set to any value<span class="line"><!----> in case base header is set , it can be set to any value<!----></span><br><br><html><head><span class="line"><!---->&lt;html&gt;&lt;head&gt;<!----></span><br>      <title>Test/title><span class="line"><!---->      &lt;title&gt;Test/title&gt;<!----></span><br>    <base href="<span class="line"><!---->    &lt;base href="<!----></span>https://www.gmail.com/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.gmail.com/"><!---->https://www.gmail.com/<!----></a>"><span class="line"><!---->"&gt;<!----></span><br><style><span         Hi, thanks: I was able to verify <span class="line"><!---->Hi, thanks: I was able to verify <!----></span><br><br><base href="<span class="line"><!---->&lt;base href="<!----></span>https://www.google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com"><!---->https://www.google.com<!----></a>"><span class="line"><!---->"&gt;<!----></span><br><style><span class="line"><!---->&lt;style&gt;<!----></span><br>    @import '<span class="line"><!---->    @import '<!----></span>https://www.flickr.com/picture.jpg';<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.flickr.com/picture.jpg';"><!---->https://www.flickr.com/picture.jpg';<!----></a><br></style><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/style&gt;<!----></span><br><br>hosted on a non-google domain resulted in a<span class="line"><!---->hosted on a non-google domain resulted in a<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a> referrer.<span class="line"><!----> referrer.<!----></span><br><br>Without the <base> tag, the request had no referrer (rather than a referrer of the initiating origin, which was what I expected).<span class="line"><!---->Without the &lt;base&gt; tag, the request had no referrer (rather than a referrer of the initiating origin, which was what I expected).<!----></span><br><br>This behavior seems to come from the following code:<span class="line"><!---->This behavior seems to come from the following code:<!----></span><br>- CSSParserContext's constructors look for a base URL (for instance from Document::BaseURL) and then set CSSParserContext::referrer_ from this value. [1]<span class="line"><!---->- CSSParserContext's constructors look for a base URL (for instance from Document::BaseURL) and then set CSSParserContext::referrer_ from this value. [1]<!----></span><br>- StyleRuleImport then uses this value when populating fetching arguments. [2]<span class="line"><!---->- StyleRuleImport then uses this value when populating fetching arguments. [2]<!----></span><br><br>[1]: <span class="line"><!---->[1]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/parser/css_parser_context.cc;l=125;drc=ec0e29ae0cc41412b3c0594f1d94ceaa3d9e3870;bpv=1;bpt=1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/parser/css_parser_context.cc;l=125;drc=ec0e29ae0cc41412b3c0594f1d94ceaa3d9e3870;bpv=1;bpt=1"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/parser/css_parser_context.cc;l=125;drc=ec0e29ae0cc41412b3c0594f1d94ceaa3d9e3870;bpv=1;bpt=1<!----></a><br>[2]: <span class="line"><!---->[2]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/style_rule_import.cc;l=152;drc=ec0e29ae0cc41412b3c0594f1d94ceaa3d9e3870;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=cssparsercontext::getreferrer&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/style_rule_import.cc;l=152;drc=ec0e29ae0cc41412b3c0594f1d94ceaa3d9e3870;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=cssparsercontext::getreferrer&amp;ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/style_rule_import.cc;l=152;drc=ec0e29ae0cc41412b3c0594f1d94ceaa3d9e3870;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=cssparsercontext::getreferrer&amp;ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc<!----></a><br><br><br>I think this is a one-line fix and have written up<span class="line"><!---->I think this is a one-line fix and have written up<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/2592447<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2592447"><!---->crrev.com/c/2592447<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>Mike is better equipped than me to assess whether there's a security impact.<span class="line"><!---->Mike is better equipped than me to assess whether there's a security         (Lukasz, I initially added you because I was curious if this could lead to initiatior mismatches, but I think the answer is probably not: we just use this information to set the referrer, not the initiator.)<span class="line"><!---->(Lukasz, I initially added you because I was curious if this could lead to initiatior mismatches, but I think the answer is probably not: we just use this information to set the referrer, not the initiator.)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Looping in also yhirano@ who has more referrer experience, and domenic@ who has commented on the github issue.<span class="line"><!---->Looping in also yhirano@ who has more referrer experience, and domenic@ who has commented on the github issue.<!----></span><br><br>I don't have a very quick answer. The two signals I'd look at are how other browsers behaves and what the spec says.<span class="line"><!---->I don't have a very quick answer. The two signals I'd look at are how other browsers behaves and what the spec says.<!----></span><br><br>As for what the spec says, this is a bit hard to chase down. From what I see, it looks like the base URL should not affect Referrer.<span class="line"><!---->As for what the spec says, this is a bit hard to chase down. From what I see, it looks like the base URL should not affect Referrer.<!----></span><br><br>1) I don't actually see where the CSS spec says to fetch @import URLs:<span class="line"><!---->1) I don't actually see where the CSS spec says to fetch @import URLs:<!----></span><br>https://drafts.csswg.org/css-cascade-4/#at-ruledef-import<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://drafts.csswg.org/css-cascade-4/#at-ruledef-import"><!---->https://drafts.csswg.org/css-cascade-4/#at-ruledef-import<!----></a><br><br>2) I assume it should do something similar to <link rel="stylesheet">. This seems to go here:<span class="line"><!---->2) I assume it should do something similar to &lt;link rel="stylesheet"&gt;. This seems to go here:<!----></span><br>https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/semantics.html#default-fetch-and-process-the-linked-resource<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/semantics.html#default-fetch-and-process-the-linked-resource"><!---->https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/semantics.html#default-fetch-and-process-the-linked-resource<!----></a><br><br>although there is a TODO and issue to use CSSOM's fetching steps instead:<span class="line"><!---->although there is a TODO and issue to use CSSOM's fetching steps instead:<!----></span><br>https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/968<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/968"><!---->https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/968<!----></a><br>https://drafts.csswg.org/cssom/#fetching-css-style-sheets<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://drafts.csswg.org/cssom/#fetching-css-style-sheets"><!---->https://drafts.csswg.org/cssom/#fetching-css-style-sheets<!----></a><br><br>3) Looking at the Fetch spec, it appears to use the document URL rather than the document base URL for the referrer:<span class="line"><!---->3) Looking at the Fetch spec, it appears to use the document URL rather than the document base URL for the referrer:<!----></span><br>"If request’s referrer is not "no-referrer", set request’s referrer to the result of invoking determine request’s referrer. [REFERRER]" at <span class="line"><!---->"If request’s referrer is not "no-referrer", set request’s referrer to the result of invoking determine request’s referrer. [REFERRER]" at <!----></span>https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#main-fetch<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#main-fetch"><!---->https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#main-fetch<!----></a><br>https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-referrer-policy/#determine-requests-referrer<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-referrer-policy/#determine-requests-referrer"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-referrer-policy/#determine-requests-referrer<!----></a><br><br>I don't see anything that says to use base URL as the referrer anywhere.<span class="line"><!---->I don't see anything that says to use base URL as the referrer anywhere.<!----></span><br><br>So I think changing to use the document URL is indeed correct. It'd be good to see if other browsers do this too. It'd be especially interesting to see when the referrer code was written, if it came from WebKit days or was intentionally added later.<span class="line"><!---->So I think changing to use the document URL is indeed correct. It'd be good to see if other browsers do this too. It'd be especially interesting to see when the referrer code was written, if it came from WebKit days or was intentionally added later.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 11<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1158010#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      mkwst@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/189620131" title="mkwst@chromium.org"><!---->mkwst@chromium.org<!----></a>
      mkwst@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->mkwst@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Dec 15, 2020, 2:00 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 15, 2020, 2:00 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1158010#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 15, 2020, 2:00 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1158010#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 15, 2020, 2:00 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          dom@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          dom@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        1.  Unless something has changed in the last year or so, fetching for CSS is not yet well-defined. <span class="line"><!---->1.  Unless something has changed in the last year or so, fetching for CSS is not yet well-defined. <!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-referrer-policy/#integration-with-css<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-referrer-policy/#integration-with-css"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-referrer-policy/#integration-with-css<!----></a> hand-waves at the problem in ways that we considered good-enough while writing it, but it would be excellent for someone (not it!) to actually hammer out the integration. dom@ might be interested.<span class="line"><!----> hand-waves at the problem in ways that we considered good-enough while writing it, but it would be excellent for someone (not it!) to actually hammer out the integration. dom@ might be interested.<!----></span><br><br>2.  Regardless of spec text, `<base>` should not influence the referrer. The text above points to what that change was supposed to achieve: the stylesheet's URL should be used as the referrer, not the document's URL. In this case, though, the stylesheet is inline in the document, so we do want to use the document's URL.<span class="line"><!---->2.  Regardless of spec text, `&lt;base&gt;` should not influence the referrer. The text above points to what that change was supposed to achieve: the stylesheet's URL should be used as the referrer, not the document's URL. In this case, though, the stylesheet is inline in the document, so we do want to use the document's URL.<!----></span><br><br>This does have security implications, insofar as some sites use `referer` as an access-control measure: it shouldn't be possible for a site to forge cross-origin `referer` headers. I'm not sure whether it's possible to send CORS-enabled requests from stylesheets (perhaps fonts?), but it would be interesting to verify that the `Origin` header and the `Sec-Fetch-Site` headers are behaving correctly as well, as I have vague recollections of those being wrapped up in the same data source as the referrer. TL;DR: Medium severity feels right.<span class="line"><!---->This does have security implications, insofar as some sites use `referer` as an access-control measure: it shouldn't be possible for a site to forge cross-origin `referer` headers. I'm not sure whether it's possible to send CORS-enabled requests from stylesheets (perhaps fonts?), but it would be interesting to verify that the `Origin` header and the `Sec-Fetch-Site` headers are behaving correctly as well, as I have vague recollections of those being wrapped up in the same data source as the referrer. TL;DR: Medium severity feels right.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>
      
      
      
        
          Comment 12<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1158010#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        yeah, the intention is that if it's an inline stylesheet, the document's referrer should be used, but if it's an standalone stylesheet, that stylesheet's base URL (well, whatever it's called, it's not defined in CSS, but it should be a thing that can't be overwritten) should be used<span class="line"><!---->yeah, the intention is that if it's an inline stylesheet, the document's referrer should be used, but if it's an standalone stylesheet, that stylesheet's base URL (well, whatever it's called, it's not defined in CSS, but it should be a thing that can't be overwritten) should be used<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        RE: <span class="line"><!---->RE: <!----></span>#c11<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c11"><!---->#c11<!----></a>: mkwst@: interesting to verify that the `Origin` header and the `Sec-Fetch-Site` headers are behaving correctly<span class="line"><!---->: mkwst@: interesting to verify that the `Origin` header and the `Sec-Fetch-Site` headers are behaving correctly<!----></span><br><br>Both `Origin` and `Sec-Fetch-Site` are based on network::ResourceRequest::request_initiator (soon-to-be-verified everywhere against `request_initiator_site_lock` and so unspoofable/protected against compromised renderers).<span class="line"><!---->Both `Origin` and `Sec-Fetch-Site` are based on network::ResourceRequest::request_initiator (soon-to-be-verified everywhere against `request_initiator_site_lock` and so unspoofable/protected against compromised renderers).<!----></span><br><br>OTOH, (based on <span class="line"><!---->OTOH, (based on <!----></span>#c12<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c12"><!---->#c12<!----></a>) it seems the `Referer` header can mismatch `request_initiator_site_lock` in the following scenario:<span class="line"><!---->) it seems the `Referer` header can mismatch `request_initiator_site_lock` in the following scenario:<!----></span><br><br>    a.com/main.html: <link rel="stylesheet" href="<span class="line"><!---->    a.com/main.html: &lt;link rel="stylesheet" href="<!----></span>https://b.com/style.css<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://b.com/style.css"><!---->https://b.com/style.css<!----></a>"><span class="line"><!---->"&gt;<!----></span><br>    b.com/style.css: @import url("<span class="line"><!---->    b.com/style.css: @import url("<!----></span>https://c.com/nested.css");<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://c.com/nested.css&quot;);"><!---->https://c.com/nested.css");<!----></a><br><br>Here, the fetch for c.com/nested.css will use `Sec-Fetch-Site` based on request_initiator=a.com (all requests within the frame use the same URLLoaderFactory), but (based on <span class="line"><!---->Here, the fetch for c.com/nested.css will use `Sec-Fetch-Site` based on request_initiator=a.com (all requests within the frame use the same URLLoaderFactory), but (based on <!----></span>#c12<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c12"><!---->#c12<!----></a>) `Referer` should be based on b.com/style.css (IIUC) - the latter is incompatible with `request_initiator_origin_lock`.<span class="line"><!---->) `Referer` should be based on b.com/style.css (IIUC) - the latter is incompatible with `request_initiator_origin_lock`.<!----></span><br><br>So, if I understood the above correctly, then we get the following conclusion: `Referer` should not be used as an access-control measure / security mechanism (because it is not secure against compromised renderers).<span class="line"><!---->So, if I understood the above correctly, then we get the following conclusion: `Referer` should not be used as an access-control measure / security mechanism (because it is not secure against compromised renderers).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        > Both `Origin` and `Sec-Fetch-Site` are ... unspoofable<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Both `Origin` and `Sec-Fetch-Site` are ... unspoofable<!----></span><br><br>Excellent, thanks Lukasz!<span class="line"><!---->Excellent, thanks Lukasz!<!----></span><br><br>> it seems the `Referer` header can mismatch `request_initiator_site_lock` in the following scenario: ... `Referer` should not be used as an access-control measure<span class="line"><!---->&gt; it seems the `Referer` header can mismatch `request_initiator_site_lock` in the following scenario: ... `Referer` should not be used as an access-control measure<!----></span><br><br>Correct. It shouldn't be used; other mechanisms are more robust. "Should", however, has little impact on "does". :) It would be ideal for us to limit the scenarios in which this mechanism has unexpected values to those that require actively corrupting the renderer. (So, I could live with "Low" severity instead of "Medium", but it's still a bug we ought to fix.)<span class="line"><!---->Correct. It shouldn't be used; other mechanisms are more robust. "Should", however, has little impact on "does". :) It would be ideal for us to limit the scenarios in which this mechanism has unexpected values to those that require actively corrupting the renderer. (So, I could live with "Low" severity instead of "Medium", but it's still a bug we ought to fix.)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

document's URL as referrer<span class="line"><!---->css: Make fetches from inline CSS use the document's URL as referrer<!----></span><br><br>Right now, fetches from inline CSS use the inline CSS's base URL<span class="line"><!---->Right now, fetches from inline CSS use the inline CSS's base URL<!----></span><br>instead of the URL from the context that embeds the inline CSS: for<span class="line"><!---->instead of the URL from the context that embeds the inline CSS: for<!----></span><br>instance, loading a<span class="line"><!---->instance, loading a<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>source-site.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source-site.com"><!---->source-site.com<!----></a> page with the following code<span class="line"><!----> page with the following code<!----></span><br>  <base href="<span class="line"><!---->  &lt;base href="<!----></span>https://other-site.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" type=text/css&gt; @import(<!----></span>'<span class="line"><!---->'<!----></span>best-sheet.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://best-sheet.com"><!---->best-sheet.com<!----></a>') </style><span class="line"><!---->') &lt;/style&gt;<!----></span><br>should lead to the<span class="line"><!---->should lead to the<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>best-sheet.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://best-sheet.com"><!---->best-sheet.com<!----></a> sheet getting fetched with a<span class="line"><!----> sheet getting fetched with a<!----></span><br>source-site.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source-site.com"><!---->source-site.com<!----></a> referrer, but it will currently provide an<span class="line"><!----> referrer, but it will currently provide an<!----></span><br>other-site.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://other-site.com"><!---->other-site.com<!----></a> referrer. However, if the imported sheet from<span class="line"><!----> referrer. However, if the imported sheet from<!----></span><br>best-sheet.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://best-sheet.com"><!---->best-sheet.com<!----></a> makes more nested fetches, those nested requests should<span class="line"><!----> makes more nested fetches, those nested requests should<!----></span><br>use<span class="line"><!---->use<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>best-sheet.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://best-sheet.com"><!---->best-sheet.com<!----></a> as the basis for their referrers (as they do<span class="line"><!----> as the basis for their referrers (as they do<!----></span><br>currently).<span class="line"><!---->currently).<!----></span><br><br>This CL updates CSSParserContext's referrer setting logic to roughly do<span class="line"><!---->This CL updates CSSParserContext's referrer setting logic to roughly do<!----></span><br>the following:<span class="line"><!---->the following:<!----></span><br>- inline CSS: use the embedding document's URL as the referrer, or, for<span class="line"><!---->- inline CSS: use the embedding document's URL as the referrer, or, for<!----></span><br>srcdoc iframes, walk up the frame tree until hitting a non-srcdoc frame<span class="line"><!---->srcdoc iframes, walk up the frame tree until hitting a non-srcdoc frame<!----></span><br>- requests from fetched stylesheets: just as currently, use the fetched<span class="line"><!---->- requests from fetched stylesheets: just as currently, use the fetched<!----></span><br>sheet's URL as the basis for constructing the referrer<span class="line"><!---->sheet's URL as the basis for constructing the referrer<!----></span><br><br>This seemed like it required refactoring CSSParserContext slightly<span class="line"><!---->This seemed like it required refactoring CSSParserContext slightly<!----></span><br>because there are constructors that take both a Document and a base URL,<span class="line"><!---->because there are constructors that take both a Document and a base URL,<!----></span><br>and it's not obvious from the constructor signature whether the<span class="line"><!---->and it's not obvious from the constructor signature whether the<!----></span><br>Document or the base URL should be the one that provides the referrer.<span class="line"><!---->Document or the base URL should be the one that provides the referrer.<!----></span><br>To resolve this ambiguity, the refactor updates these CSSParserContext<span class="line"><!---->To resolve this ambiguity, the refactor updates these CSSParserContext<!----></span><br>constructors to take caller-provided Referrer objects.<span class="line"><!---->constructors to take caller-provided Referrer objects.<!----></span><br><br>Change-Id: If5a99d8057dff5e771e821d0e1f605566e28ff1d<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id:         This bug requires manual review: We are only 10 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 10 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: govind@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), marinakz@(ChromeOS), srinivassista @(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: govind@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), marinakz@(ChromeOS), srinivassista @(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

But if there's any doubt at all about stability risks, we don't, so I'll adjust labels thusly.<span class="line"><!---->Per policy yes, for externally reported medium severity bugs we do merge them back to both beta and stable.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

as the basis for their referrers (as they do<!----></span><br>currently).<span class="line"><!---->currently).<!----></span><br><br>This CL updates CSSParserContext's referrer setting logic to roughly do<span class="line"><!---->This CL updates CSSParserContext's referrer setting logic to roughly do<!----></span><br>the following:<span class="line"><!---->the following:<!----></span><br>- inline CSS: use the embedding document's URL as the referrer, or, for<span class="line"><!---->- inline CSS: use the embedding document's URL as the referrer, or, for<!----></span><br>srcdoc iframes, walk up the frame tree until hitting a non-srcdoc frame<span class="line"><!---->srcdoc iframes, walk up the frame tree until hitting a non-srcdoc frame<!----></span><br>- requests from fetched stylesheets: just as currently, use the fetched<span class="line"><!---->- requests from fetched stylesheets: just as currently, use the fetched<!----></span><br>sheet's URL as the basis for constructing the referrer<span class="line"><!---->sheet's URL as the basis for constructing the referrer<!----></span><br><br>This seemed like it required refactoring CSSParserContext slightly<span class="line"><!---->This seemed like it required refactoring CSSParserContext slightly<!----></span><br>because there are constructors that take both a Document and a base URL,<span class="line"><!---->because there are constructors that take both a Document and a base URL,<!----></span><br>and it's not obvious from the constructor signature whether the<span class="line"><!---->and it's not obvious from the constructor signature whether the<!----></span><br>Document or the base URL should be the one that provides the referrer.<span class="line"><!---->Document or the base URL should be the one that provides the referrer.<!----></span><br>To resolve this ambiguity, the refactor updates these CSSParserContext<span class="line"><!---->To resolve this ambiguity, the refactor updates these CSSParserContext<!----></span><br>constructors to take caller-provided Referrer objects.<span class="line"><!---->constructors to take caller-provided Referrer objects.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>0b1539fcb923056624d4adc84b88140d367d92da<a           Clock icons indicate that users may not be available.
          Tooltips show the reason.

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>While doing some analysis it was observed that when a <base> tag is set to a page and a css request is being made to a page, Chrome browser makes use of the url in base tag as a referrer header value , this is only valid in case a base header is set , in case the header is absent a plain requirest is made to the url for css call.<span class="line"><!---->While doing some analysis it was observed that when a &lt;base&gt; tag is set to a page and a css request is being made to a page, Chrome browser makes use of the url in base tag as a referrer header value , this is only valid in case a base header is set , in case the header is absent a plain requirest is made to the url for css call.<!----></span><br><br>This was only observed with chrome and other browsers set the referrer to URI requesting the resource.<span class="line"><!---->This was only observed with chrome and other browsers set the referrer to URI requesting the resource.<!----></span><br><br>For example in below code, chrome doesnt set any referrer header automatically when making request to<span class="line"><!---->For example in below code, chrome doesnt set any referrer header automatically when making request to<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>x.burpcollaborator.net<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://x.burpcollaborator.net"><!---->x.burpcollaborator.net<!----></a> .<span class="line"><!----> .<!----></span><br><br><br><html><head><span class="line"><!---->&lt;html&gt;&lt;head&gt;<!----></span><br>      <title>Test</title><span class="line"><!---->      &lt;title&gt;Test&lt;/title&gt;<!----></span><br><style><span class="line"><!---->&lt;style&gt;<!----></span><br>    @import '<span class="line"><!---->    @import '<!----></span>https://x.burpcollaborator.net/x';<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://x.burpcollaborator.net/x';"><!---->https://x.burpcollaborator.net/x';<!----></a><!--change this to any address of your choice and verify the referrer header!--><span class="line"><!---->&lt;!--change this to any address of your choice and verify the referrer header!--&gt;<!----></span><br></style><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/style&gt;<!----></span><br>   </head><span class="line"><!---->   &lt;/head&gt;<!----></span><br>   <body><span class="line"><!---->   &lt;body&gt;<!----></span><br>test<span class="line"><!---->test<!----></span><br><body></html><span class="line"><!---->&lt;body&gt;&lt;/html&gt;<!----></span><br><br><br>However in below code a referrer header is set to<span class="line"><!---->However in below code a referrer header is set to<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a> in case base header is set , it can be set to any value<span class="line"><!----> in case base header is set , it can be set to any value<!----></span><br><br><html><head><span class="line"><!---->&lt;html&gt;&lt;head&gt;<!----></span><br>      <title>Test/title><span class="line"><!---->      &lt;title&gt;Test/title&gt;<!----></span><br>    <base href="<span class="line"><!---->    &lt;base href="<!----></span>https://www.gmail.com/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.gmail.com/"><!---->https://www.gmail.com/<!----></a>"><span class="line"><!---->"&gt;<!----></span><br><style><span class="line"><!---->&lt;style&gt;<!----></span><br>    @import '<span class="line"><!---->    @import '<!----></span>https://x.burpcollaborator.net/x';<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://x.burpcollaborator.net/x';"><!---->https://x.burpcollaborator.net/x';<!----></a><!--change this to any address of your choice and verify the referrer header!--><span class="line"><!---->&lt;!--change this to any address of your choice and verify the referrer header!--&gt;<!----></span><br></style><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/style&gt;<!----></span><br>   </head><span class="line"><!---->   &lt;/head&gt;<!----></span><br>   <body><span class="line"><!---->   &lt;body&gt;<!----></span><br>test<span class="line"><!---->test<!----></span><br><body></html><span class="line"><!---->&lt;body&gt;&lt;/html&gt;<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Latest (83.0.4103.61) <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Latest (83.0.4103.61) <!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows, Mac , Android<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows, Mac , Android<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please use below code and save it as html and open via chrome<span class="line"><!---->Please use below code and save it as html and open via chrome<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Ashish Gautam Kamble<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Ashish Gautam Kamble<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for your report. This might be a spec issue rather than a security issue. I'm unsure how an attacker could use this to endanger users, since they would already have to control the website in order to set the base tag.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your report. This might be a spec issue rather than a security issue. I'm unsure how an attacker could use this to endanger users, since they would already have to control the website in order to set the base tag.<!----></span><br><br>Can you elaborate on how this might be leveraged into an attack?
